note.p: Daughter of the chief cashier of the Bank of England, Matthew Marshall. Provisional committee member of the Association of Liberal Thinkers, 1878. Made a generous bequest to Imperial College, London.
Census returns of England and Wales 1871 (The National Archives: Public Record Office RG10/872/23/38), 1881 (RG11/50/112/15)
Correspondence vol. 26, letter from M. D. Conway, 18 November 1878
England & Wales, national probate calendar (index of wills and administrations), 1858–1966, 1973–95 (Ancestry.com, accessed 17 March 2014)
England & Wales, non-conformist and non-parochial registers, 1567–1970 (Ancestry.com, accessed 17 March 2014)
